   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    Singapore
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>

     </a>

     </a>

    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <div class="hatnote" role="note">
      This article is about the city-state. For other uses, see
      <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Singapore_(disambiguation)" title="Singapore (disambiguation)">
       Singapore (disambiguation)
      </a>
      .
     </div>

        <div style="width:52px">
         <img alt="Unbalanced scales.svg" data-file-height="354" data-file-width="400" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Unbalanced_scales.svg/45px-Unbalanced_scales.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Unbalanced_scales.svg/68px-Unbalanced_scales.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Unbalanced_scales.svg/90px-Unbalanced_scales.svg.png 2x" width="45"/>
        </div>
       </td>
       <td class="mbox-text">
        <span class="mbox-text-span">
         The
         <b>
          <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Neutral_point_of_view" title="Wikipedia:Neutral point of view">
           neutrality
          </a>
          of this
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Lead_section" title="Wikipedia:Lead section">
           article's introduction
          </a>
          is
          <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:NPOV_dispute" title="Wikipedia:NPOV dispute">
           disputed
          </a>
         </b>
         .
         <span class="hide-when-compact">
          Relevant discussion may be found on the
          <a href="/wiki/Talk:Singapore#POV_and_WP:UNDUE_in_lead" title="Talk:Singapore">
           talk page
          </a>
          . Please do not remove this message until
          <a href="/wiki/Template:POV#When_to_remove" title="Template:POV">
           conditions to do so are met
          </a>
          .
         </span>
         <small>
          <i>
           (September 2016)
          </i>
         </small>
         <small class="hide-when-compact">
          <i>

          </i>
         </small>
        </span>

          </li>
          <li>
           13.4%
           <a href="/wiki/Malay_Singaporeans" title="Malay Singaporeans">
            Malay
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           9.2%
           <a href="/wiki/Indian_Singaporeans" title="Indian Singaporeans">
            Indian
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           3.3% others
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

         Internet TLD
        </a>
       </th>
       <td>
        <div class="hlist">
         <ul>
          <li>
           <a href="/wiki/.sg" title=".sg">
            .sg
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/.%E6%96%B0%E5%8A%A0%E5%9D%A1" title=".新加坡">
            .新加坡
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/.%E0%AE%9A%E0%AE%BF%E0%AE%99%E0%AF%8D%E0%AE%95%E0%AE%AA%E0%AF%8D%E0%AE%AA%E0%AF%82%E0%AE%B0%E0%AF%8D" title=".சிங்கப்பூர்">
            .சிங்கப்பூர்
           </a>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </td>
      </tr>
     </table>
     <p>
      <b>
       Singapore
      </b>
      (
      <span class="nowrap">
       <span class="noexcerpt">
        <a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/36/En-us-Singapore.ogg" title="Listen">
         <img alt="Listen" data-file-height="11" data-file-width="11" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/11px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/17px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Speakerlink-new.svg/22px-Speakerlink-new.svg.png 2x" width="11"/>
        </a>
        <sup>
         <span class="IPA" style="color:#00e;font:bold 80% sans-serif;padding:0 .1em">
          <a href="/wiki/File:En-us-Singapore.ogg" title="File:En-us-Singapore.ogg">
           i
          </a>
         </span>
        </sup>
       </span>
       <span class="IPA nopopups">
        <a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_English" title="Help:IPA for English">
         /
         <span style="border-bottom:1px dotted">
          <span title="/ˈ/ primary stress follows">
           ˈ
          </span>
          <span title="'s' in 'sigh'">
           s
          </span>
          <span title="/ɪ/ short 'i' in 'bid'">
           ɪ
          </span>
          <span title="/ŋɡ/ 'ng' in 'finger'">
           ŋɡ
          </span>
          <span title="/ə/ 'a' in 'about'">
           ə
          </span>
          <span title="'p' in 'pie'">
           p
          </span>
          <span title="/ɔːr/ 'or' in 'born'">
           ɔːr
          </span>
         </span>
         /
        </a>
       </span>
      </span>
      ), officially the
      <b>
       Republic of Singapore
      </b>
      , and often referred to as the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Etymology_of_Singapore" title="Etymology of Singapore">
       <i>
        Lion City
       </i>
       , the
       <i>
        Garden City
       </i>
       , and the
       <i>
        Red Dot
       </i>
      </a>
      , is a sovereign state and
      <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">
       global city
      </a>
      in
      <a href="/wiki/Southeast_Asia" title="Southeast Asia">
       Southeast Asia
      </a>
      , and the world's only
      <a href="/wiki/Island_country" title="Island country">
       island
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/City-state" title="City-state">
       city-state
      </a>
      . It lies
      <a href="/wiki/Latitude" title="Latitude">
       one degree
      </a>
      (137 km) north of the
      <a href="/wiki/Equator" title="Equator">
       equator
      </a>
      , south of the southernmost tip of
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Continental_Asia" title="Continental Asia">
       continental Asia
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Peninsular_Malaysia" title="Peninsular Malaysia">
       peninsular Malaysia
      </a>
      , with
      <a href="/wiki/Indonesia" title="Indonesia">
       Indonesia
      </a>
      's
      <a href="/wiki/Riau_Islands" title="Riau Islands">
       Riau Islands
      </a>
      to the south. Singapore's territory consists of a
      <a href="/wiki/Pulau_Ujong" title="Pulau Ujong">
       diamond-shaped main island
      </a>
      along with
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_of_Singapore" title="List of islands of Singapore">
       62 other islets
      </a>
      . Since
      <a href="/wiki/Independence" title="Independence">
       independence
      </a>
      , extensive
      <a href="/wiki/Land_reclamation" title="Land reclamation">
       land reclamation
      </a>
      has increased its total size by 23% (130 km
      <sup>
       2
      </sup>
      ), and its
      <a href="/wiki/National_Parks_Board" title="National Parks Board">
       greening policy
      </a>
      has covered the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Densely_populated" title="Densely populated">
       densely populated
      </a>
      island with
      <a href="/wiki/Tropics" title="Tropics">
       tropical
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Flora" title="Flora">
       flora
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_parks_in_Singapore" title="List of parks in Singapore">
       parks and gardens
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      In 1819,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sir_Stamford_Raffles" title="Sir Stamford Raffles">
       Sir Stamford Raffles
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/Founding_of_modern_Singapore" title="Founding of modern Singapore">
       founded colonial Singapore
      </a>
      as a
      <a href="/wiki/Trading_post" title="Trading post">
       trading post
      </a>
      of the
      <a href="/wiki/East_India_Company" title="East India Company">
       East India Company
      </a>
      ; after the establishment of the
      <a href="/wiki/British_Raj" title="British Raj">
       British Raj
      </a>
      , the islands were ceded to
      <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">
       Britain
      </a>
      and became part of its
      <a href="/wiki/Straits_Settlements" title="Straits Settlements">
       Straits Settlements
      </a>
      in 1826. During
      <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">
       World War II
      </a>
      , Singapore was
      <a href="/wiki/Japanese_occupation_of_Singapore" title="Japanese occupation of Singapore">
       occupied by Japan
      </a>
      . It gained independence from Britain in 1963, by federating with other former British territories to form
      <a href="/wiki/Malaysia" title="Malaysia">
       Malaysia
      </a>
      , but was expelled two years later over
      <a href="/wiki/Malaysian_Malaysia" title="Malaysian Malaysia">
       racial discrimination
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Singapore_in_Malaysia" title="Singapore in Malaysia">
       ideological differences
      </a>
      . After early years of
      <a href="/wiki/History_of_the_Republic_of_Singapore#1965_to_1979" title="History of the Republic of Singapore">
       turbulence
      </a>
      , and despite lacking
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Natural_resources" title="Natural resources">
       natural resources
      </a>
      and a
      <a href="/wiki/Hinterland" title="Hinterland">
       hinterland
      </a>
      , the new independent nation developed rapidly as an
      <a href="/wiki/Four_Asian_Tigers" title="Four Asian Tigers">
       Asian Tiger
      </a>
      economy, based on
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/External_trade" title="External trade">
       external trade
      </a>
      and its
      <a href="/wiki/Human_capital" title="Human capital">
       human capital
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      Singapore is a global commerce, finance and transport hub. Its standings include: the most
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Global_Information_Technology_Report" title="Global Information Technology Report">
       "technology-ready"
      </a>
      nation
      <a href="/wiki/World_Economic_Forum" title="World Economic Forum">
       (WEF)
      </a>
      , top
      <a href="/wiki/Union_of_International_Associations" title="Union of International Associations">
       International-meetings city (UIA)
      </a>
      , city with "best investment potential" (BERI), 2nd-
      <a href="/wiki/Global_Competitiveness_Report" title="Global Competitiveness Report">
       most competitive country
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/World_Economic_Forum" title="World Economic Forum">
       (WEF)
      </a>
      , 3rd-largest
      <a href="/wiki/Foreign_exchange_market" title="Foreign exchange market">
       foreign exchange
      </a>
      centre, 3rd-largest
      <a href="/wiki/Financial_centre" title="Financial centre">
       financial centre
      </a>
      , 3rd-largest
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Oil_refining" title="Oil refining">
       oil refining
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Commodity_market" title="Commodity market">
       trading
      </a>
      centre and one of the top two
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_world%27s_busiest_container_ports" title="List of world's busiest container ports">
       busiest container ports
      </a>
      since the 1990s. Singapore's best known global brands include
      <a href="/wiki/Singapore_Airlines" title="Singapore Airlines">
       Singapore Airlines
      </a>
      (SIA) and
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Changi_Airport" title="Changi Airport">
       Changi Airport
      </a>
      , both amongst the most-awarded in their industry. For the past decade, it has been the only Asian country with the
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_credit_rating" title="List of countries by credit rating">
       top AAA sovereign rating
      </a>
      from all major
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Credit_rating_agencies" title="Credit rating agencies">
       credit rating agencies
      </a>
      , including
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S%26P" title="S&amp;P">
       S&amp;P
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Moody%27s" title="Moody's">
       Moody's
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Fitch_Ratings" title="Fitch Ratings">
       Fitch
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      Singapore ranks high on its national
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Social_policies" title="Social policies">
       social policies
      </a>
      , leading Asia and 11th globally, on the
      <a href="/wiki/Human_Development_Index" title="Human Development Index">
       Human Development Index
      </a>
      <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">
       (UN)
      </a>
      , notably on
      <a href="/wiki/International_rankings_of_Singapore" title="International rankings of Singapore">
       key measures
      </a>
      of
      <a href="/wiki/Education_in_Singapore" title="Education in Singapore">
       education
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Healthcare_in_Singapore" title="Healthcare in Singapore">
       healthcare
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">
       life expectancy
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Mercer_Quality_of_Living_Survey" title="Mercer Quality of Living Survey">
       quality of life
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_intentional_homicide_rate" title="List of countries by intentional homicide rate">
       personal safety
      </a>
      , and housing. Although income inequality is high,
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_home_ownership_rate" title="List of countries by home ownership rate">
       90% of resident households own their homes
      </a>
      , and the country has one of the
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(PPP)_per_capita" title="List of countries by GDP (PPP) per capita">
       highest per capita incomes
      </a>
      , with
      <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_tax_rates" title="List of countries by tax rates">
       low taxes
      </a>
      . Singapore is home to 5.6 million residents, 38% of whom are
      <a href="/wiki/Permanent_residency_in_Singapore" title="Permanent residency in Singapore">
       permanent residents
      </a>
      and other
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Foreign_nationals" title="Foreign nationals">
       foreign nationals
      </a>
      . Singaporeans are mostly
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bilingual" title="Bilingual">
       bilingual
      </a>
      in a
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mother-tongue" title="Mother-tongue">
       mother-tongue
      </a>
      language and
      <a href="/wiki/English_language" title="English language">
       English
      </a>
      as their common language. Its
      <a href="/wiki/Cultural_diversity" title="Cultural diversity">
       cultural diversity
      </a>
      is reflected in its extensive ethnic
      <a href="/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine" title="Singaporean cuisine">
       "hawker" cuisine
      </a>
      and major
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Festivals" title="Festivals">
       festivals
      </a>
      —
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_Singaporean" title="Chinese Singaporean">
       Chinese
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Malays_in_Singapore" title="Malays in Singapore">
       Malay
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indians_in_Singapore" title="Indians in Singapore">
       Indian
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Western_world" title="Western world">
       Western
      </a>
      —which are all
      <a href="/wiki/Public_holidays_in_Singapore" title="Public holidays in Singapore">
       national holidays
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      It is noted for its effective,
      <a href="/wiki/Realpolitik" title="Realpolitik">
       pragmatic
      </a>
      and
      <a href="/wiki/Corruption_Perceptions_Index" title="Corruption Perceptions Index">
       incorrupt
      </a>
      governance and
      <a href="/wiki/Civil_service" title="Civil service">
       civil service
      </a>
      , which together with its rapid development policies, is widely cited as the "Singapore model".
      <a href="/wiki/Gallup_(company)" title="Gallup (company)">
       Gallup
      </a>
      polls shows 84% of its residents expressed confidence in the national government, and 85% in its judicial systems—one of the highest ratings recorded. Singapore has significant influence on global affairs relative to its size, leading some analysts to classify it as a
      <a href="/wiki/Middle_power" title="Middle power">
       middle power
      </a>
      . It is ranked as Asia's most influential city and 4th in the world by
      <i>
       <a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">
        Forbes
       </a>
      </i>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      Singapore is a
      <a href="/wiki/Unitary_state" title="Unitary state">
       unitary
      </a>
      ,
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Multiparty" title="Multiparty">
       multiparty
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_republic" title="Parliamentary republic">
       parliamentary republic
      </a>
      , with a
      <a href="/wiki/Westminster_system" title="Westminster system">
       Westminster system
      </a>
      of
      <a href="/wiki/Unicameralism" title="Unicameralism">
       unicameral
      </a>
      parliamentary government, but is classified as being "partly free" by
      <a href="/wiki/Freedom_House" title="Freedom House">
       Freedom House
      </a>
      . The
      <a href="/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party" title="People's Action Party">
       People's Action Party
      </a>
      has won every election since self-government in 1959. One of the five founding members of the
      <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ASEAN" title="ASEAN">
       ASEAN
      </a>
      , Singapore is also the host of the
      <a href="/wiki/Asia-Pacific_Economic_Cooperation" title="Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation">
       Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation
      </a>
      (APEC) Secretariat, and a member of the
      <a href="/wiki/East_Asia_Summit" title="East Asia Summit">
       East Asia Summit
      </a>
      ,
      <a href="/wiki/Non-Aligned_Movement" title="Non-Aligned Movement">
       Non-Aligned Movement
      </a>
      , and the
      <a href="/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations" title="Commonwealth of Nations">
       Commonwealth of Nations
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>
